info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 1:28PM EDT until March 20 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Boston/Norton MA
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Massachusetts...
Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut...
Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties.
Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties.
Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...
Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties.
For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Connecticut River at Thompsonville.
* WHEN...Until late Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Lowland flooding will begin along the Connecticut River near Thompsonville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING
